name: Workshop: Getting to know Android Studio & Gradle
tagline: A workshop, originally created for Droidcon Eastern Europe, for introducing people into Android Studio and Gradle
body:
## Table of contents - [Introduction](#introduction) - [Target audience](#target-audience) - [Requirements](#requirements) - [Part 1: Import an existing project from Eclipse](#part-1-import-an-existing-project-from-eclipse) - [Part 2: Meet Android Studio](#part-2-meet-android-studio) - [Part 3: Setup a gradle project from scratch](#part-3-setup-a-gradle-project-from-scratch) - [Part 4: Understanding Gradle](#part-4-understanding-gradle) - [Part 5: Customize the Gradle build](#part-5-customize-the-gradle-build) - [Part 6: Sign your android app ready for the Play Store](#part-6-sign-your-android-app-ready-for-the-play-store) - [Helpers](#helpers) - [Copyright/License](#copyrightlicense) ##Introduction Android Studio is an integrated development environment (IDE) for the Android platform. It was announced on 16 May 2013 by Google’s Product Manager, Ellie Powers, at that year’s Google I/O conference. As of June 2013, it is available for users to try (for free) as an early access preview. This workshop will take you through the IntelliJ-based IDE as well as the new build process. It will teach you how to create new projects, import exinting ones and how to modify the build script. ##Target audience This workshop is created for developers with some experience in Android as it won't explain anything regarding Android itself. Experience with Eclipse and ADT helps understand the differences and improvements Android Studio with Gradle brings. ##Requirements To participate in this hands-on workshop so it's required to bring: - a laptop - a device or emulator running Android 4.0 or better. To make the best of the workshop time it's recommended to download and install the following: - Android SDK & Android Studio: [Bundled download here](http://developer.android.com/sdk/installing/studio.html) - Gradle [Download](http://www.gradle.org/downloads) - Demo files [Download as ZIP](https://github.com/stefanhoth/workshop-androidstudio-gradle/zipball/master) or [clone the repo](https://github.com/stefanhoth/workshop-androidstudio-gradle/tree/master) ##Part 1: Import an existing project from Eclipse Android Studio has not a specific import for Android Eclipse projects yet. Instead it's recommended to export the project **from Eclipse to Gradle**. ![Android Studio](https://raw.github.com/stefanhoth/workshop-androidstudio-gradle/gh-pages/images/step1_export.png) - Open the project `eclipse_project/DroidconWorkshop` in Eclipse - Make sure to have the latest Android Developer Tools installed (22.0+) - Select your project in the Package Explorer - Select File -> Export... - Find "Generate Gradle Build Files" - Hit Next - Select the projects you want to export - Hit Next - Review the settings and hit Finish Now the project in Android Studio can be imported as a normal Gradle project. ##Part 2: Meet Android Studio ![Android Studio](https://raw.github.com/stefanhoth/workshop-androidstudio-gradle/gh-pages/images/step2_android_studio.png "Android Studio at a glance") ##Part 3: Setup a gradle project from scratch Before starting make you your build tools and Android/Google repositories are up to date. ![Android Studio](https://raw.github.com/stefanhoth/workshop-androidstudio-gradle/gh-pages/images/step3_android-sdk1.png "Build Tools") ![Android Studio](https://raw.github.com/stefanhoth/workshop-androidstudio-gradle/gh-pages/images/step3_android-sdk2.png "Repositories") ##Part 4: Understanding Gradle ##Part 5: Customize the Gradle build ###Changing the name of your output apk Let's name the project a bit differently and add the version number to the file. android { compileSdkVersion 18 buildToolsVersion "18.1" compileOptions.encoding = "UTF-8" defaultConfig { versionCode 1 versionName "0.5.0" minSdkVersion 10 targetSdkVersion 18 } //... applicationVariants.all { variant -> def apk = variant.outputFile; def newName = ""; newName = apk.name.replace(".apk", "-v" + defaultConfig.versionName + "-" + variant.buildType.name.toUpperCase() + ".apk"); newName = newName .replace("-" + variant.buildType.name, "") .replace(project.name, "AwesomeApp"); variant.outputFile = new File(apk.parentFile, newName); logger.info('INFO: Set outputFile to ' + variant.outputFile + " for [" + variant.name + "]"); } } ### Allow to install the debug build along the the Play Store version android { defaultConfig { versionName "1.0.0" } buildTypes { debug { packageNameSuffix = ".debug" versionNameSuffix = "-DEBUG" } } } ### Create an alpha build for the Play Store Alpha feature android { defaultConfig { versionName "1.0.0" } buildTypes { debug { packageNameSuffix = ".debug" versionNameSuffix = "-DEBUG" } alpha.initWith(buildTypes.debug) alpha { packageNameSuffix = "" versionNameSuffix = "-ALPHA" zipAlign true signingConfig signingConfigs.release } } } ##Part 6: Sign your android app ready for the Play Store ##Helpers - [Google Gradle Plugin Manual](http://tools.android.com/tech-docs/new-build-system/user-guide) - [Gradle Please](http://gradleplease.appspot.com) - [Gradle Dependency Helper Plugin for IntelliJ/Android Studio](https://github.com/ligi/GradleDependenciesHelperPlugin) ##Copyright / License
